description:
Description
===========
Recoverable error: Unexpected API Error.
<class 'sqlalchemy.exc.OperationalError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-99afec9c-b02f-4a64-b718-0109b1836743)

Steps to reproduce
==================
1. launch 250+ CirrOSes with flavor cirros64 (same as cirros256 but with 64M ram)
2.navigate to /project/instances in horizon
3. select instance name and write a proper prefix having '0' in it the press filter.

Expected result
===============
Instance list

Actual result
=============
Error: Unable to retrieve instances
The following appeared in devstack nova log: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/618749/

Environment
===========
I'm using devstack fc2919f the setup is running on a  Dell T7810 and has 251 instances launched and running.
Hypervisor: libvirt+kvm
Storage: LVM shipped with devstack
networking: Neutron with OpenVSwitch


Logs & Configs
==============
base64 encoded  sosreport-trunkport-20170818113155.tar.xz : http://paste.openstack.org/raw/618752/

comments.content: To be clear, you're just trying to list instances and filtering the name using "0" as the instance display name filter, correct?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Looking at the stacktrace in http://paste.openstack.org/raw/618749/ we don't even get to the DB API call for Nova to query the instances table.

It looks like you're probably leaking connections? Or something else has a bunch of open connections already.

Using mysql, devstack will set the max connections to 1024:

iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld max_connections 1024

Could you check the max connections in my.conf when this fails?

I'm not aware of any other good ways to find out what other open connections there are to the DB when you hit this, but that would be information we probably need.

This might provide some pointers for debug:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1620662/mysql-see-all-open-connections-to-a-given-database
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
